comments:
Using the I-3 smoke test build dated 05070853 on Linux RedHat Enterprise 4, unable to run a manual test against the AC.  The manual test GUI does not appear and the test terminates.  Upon inspecting the execution event log, there is an error message as follows:

IWAT0869E The Manual Test View could not be launched due to the following reason:
No more handles (java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: no swt-mozilla-gtk-3339 or swt-mozilla-gtk in swt.library.path, java.library.path or the jar file)

The Manual Test View requires one of the follow Web browsers to be installed and configured:
-Mozilla v1.4 GTK2 or above.
-Firefox v1.0 or above.
-XULRunner v1.8.0.1 or above.

Additionally, the installed Web browser must be configured by completing the following steps:
-Set the MOZILLA_FIVE_HOME environment variable to the installation folder for the Web browser (for example, export MOZILLA_FIVE_HOME=<Web browser installation directory>).
-Set the LD_LIBRARY_PATH environment variable to include the MOZILLA_FIVE_HOME environment variable (for example, export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=$MOZILLA_FIVE_HOME:$LD_LIBRARY_PATH).

I have not made any configuration changes and have run manual tests on the machine many times before.  Liz is reporting similar error results.
*** Bug 186207 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 186206 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Duwayne, can you:

1) Confirm the swt-mozilla-gtk-3339 or swt-mozilla-gtk files are shipped with the Agent Controller?

2) Confirm your environment (e.g. swt.library.path, java.library.path, LD_LIBRARY_PATH and MOZILLA_FIVE_HOME)?

3) Try running https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/attachment.cgi?id=38323 on your Linux machine?

Thanks.

Ran the attachment in comment 3 as a Java Application from the IDE.  The error results are the same for both the 1.4.2 and 1.5 SR4 IBM JVM's.  This is running under Linux RedHat Enterprise 4.  Here are the exception messages:

Exception in thread "main" org.eclipse.swt.SWTError: No more handles (java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: no swt-mozilla-gtk-3339 or swt-mozilla-gtk in swt.library.path, java.library.path or the jar file)
	at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:3573)
	at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:3465)
	at org.eclipse.swt.browser.Mozilla.create(Mozilla.java:334)
	at org.eclipse.swt.browser.Browser.<init>(Browser.java:109)
	at urlautotest.TestShell.buildWindow(TestShell.java:80)
	at urlautotest.TestShell.<init>(TestShell.java:33)
	at urlautotest.TestShell.main(TestShell.java:92)
Caused by: java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: no swt-mozilla-gtk-3339 or swt-mozilla-gtk in swt.library.path, java.library.path or the jar file
	at org.eclipse.swt.internal.Library.loadLibrary(Library.java:219)
	at org.eclipse.swt.internal.Library.loadLibrary(Library.java:151)
	at org.eclipse.swt.browser.Mozilla.create(Mozilla.java:319)
	... 4 more

Here is the OS data from the Linux machine, uname -a:
Linux dmorris-redhat.raleigh.ibm.com 2.6.9-34.0.2.EL #1 Fri Jun 30 10:23:19 EDT 2006 i686 i686 i386 GNU/Linux

This may potentially be a configuration (library dependencies) issue since we are able to run Manual tests on Linux using the TPTP-4.4.0-200705080100C build once https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=175264 was patched.  

Waiting for a reply from the SWT Team to confirm (https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=186450#c9).

Using the TPTP-4.4.0-200705310943 driver on SLES 10/IBM JRE 1.5 SR4, I cannot reproduce this problem.

Awaiting for SWT to provide a resolution.
Reporter: Please verify and close in preparation for shutting down the TPTP 4.4 release.  Thanks.
Verified that correcting the environment by setting MOZILLA_FIVE_HOME to a valid browser install path fixed the problem.  It had been inadvertently changed recently.
